page.title: 04Stanmore Hall
page.content: The hall was built between 1860 and 1865 for Mr.Pritchard , a solicitor in London,who, in the 1850's came to Bridgnorth to rid himseif of an illness. In the 1860's he asked for a house to be built on an estate called Stanmore.The house would be called Stanmore Hall. Whilst living there Mr. Pritchard became M.P. for Bridgnorth. When Mr. Pritchard died, Lady La Boucher took over the hall.Locally, she also owned Dudmaston Hall,so she asked for a private path to be made from Stanmore to Dudmaston Hall for her private use alone. This beautiful classic style building is situated in woodland high above the Severn Valley. Its grounds graced by peacocks and a variety of wild life.
